etymology.description: Pictogram: originally a serpent with a whiskered mouth and eyes; current standard form developed in large seal script. The simplified 龙 comes via variant 𢅛 of 龍, removing 帝 and reducing the 彡 strokes.
etymology.interpretation: Evokes a whiskered, serpentine creature with eyes and maw; later scripts abstracted the curves and details into a compact emblem. The PRC simplification streamlines earlier variants by dropping an upper element and trimming the beard strokes while keeping the dragon’s iconic silhouette.
etymology.simplification: Stroke-count reduction in script reform: removed the 帝 component from the 𢅛 variant and pared down 彡 to speed writing and improve legibility.

examples.chinese: 中国人把龙当作吉祥的象征(中國人把龍當作吉祥的象徵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó rén bǎ lóng dāngzuò jíxiáng de xiàngzhēng.
examples.english: Chinese people regard the dragon as an auspicious symbol.

examples.chinese: 今年是龙年(今年是龍年)。
examples.english: This year is the Year of the Dragon.

examples.chinese: 那条龙在云中盘旋(那條龍在雲中盤旋)。
examples.pinyin: Nà tiáo lóng zài yún zhōng pánxuán.
examples.english: That dragon is circling in the clouds.
